sentences: Rääkisi omateada tasa, kuid ometi kuulsime kõik ära.
Kui ka ei osta, siis vaadata võib ometi.
context: The Estonian adverb 'ometi' is a versatile word that serves multiple functions. It can mean 'still,' 'nevertheless,' or 'anyway' to indicate something happens despite obstacles (e.g., 'Proovida, küsida võiksime ometi' - We could still try asking). It also adds emphasis to express various emotions like surprise ('Kui peen seal ometi oli!' - How fine it was there after all!), insistence ('Mine ometi ära!' - Go away anyway!), or wonder ('See ei või ometi tõsi olla!' - This can't possibly be true!). Additionally, it conveys concession meaning 'after all' or 'anyway' in statements (e.g., 'Töö tuleb ometi kellelgi ära teha' - The work has to be done by someone after all).
